page.shortlink: api sql namespace result set object to excel function
page.description: Convert ResultSet to an Excel 2003 format (.xls) or 2007 format (.xlsx) file.
page.prototype: result as L = toExcel(DestinationFile as C [, SheetName as C [, IncludeHeadings as L [, RowsToCopy as N [, StartRow as N [, ReferenceColumns as SQL::TableInfo [, UserContext as P]]]]]])

argument.name: DestinationFile
argument.description: The name of the Excel file.

argument.name: SheetName
argument.description: Optional. The name of the sheet that contains the data in the Excel file.

argument.name: IncludeHeadings
argument.description: Optional. Default value is *[xb:.t.]*. Defines whether or not headings should be included in the Excel file. If *[xb:.f.]*, headings will not be included.

argument.name: RowsToCopy
argument.description: Optional. Default value is -1. The number of rows to copy to the Excel file.

argument.name: StartRow
argument.description: Optional. Default value is -1. Defines the first row of data to copy from the ResultSet.

argument.name: ReferenceColumns
argument.description: Optional. A SQL::TableInfo object that can be used to transform the data in the result set.

argument.name: UserContext
argument.description: Optional. Used to resolve any data transformations.

section.example:
dim cn as SQL::Connection dim rs as SQL::ResultSet dim sql as C = "SELECT * FROM Customers" dim filename as c = "C:\path\to\Northwind_Customers.xls"
' Open connection to Northwind Access database cn.open("::Name::Northwind") cn.execute(sql)
if (cn.ResultSet.toExcel(filename) = .f.) then ui_msg_box("An error occured: " + cn.ResultSet.CallResult) end if
cn.close()
